shapes¶

Contains definitions of shapes contained within tiles, as well as methods associated with them.

Author: Marek Dohnal

Date: 19/03/2023

class shapes.Shape(color=(120, 0, 0), size=10, type=Shapes.SQUARE_45DEG)¶

Bases: object

An inner shape of a cell

color¶

The color of a shape

draw(grid, out_img, start)¶

Draws a grown shape into an output image

Parameters:

  • grid – The original input grid

  • out_img – The output image

  • start – Starting position for growth (last point in the fill_layers attribute of a tile)

size¶

The size of a shape (number of layers for CONTOUR, number of steps for grown shapes)

type¶

Type of a shape

class shapes.Shapes(value)¶

Bases: Enum

Types of shapes that can occur within a tile

SQUARE = 3¶
SQUARE_45DEG = 4¶
TRIANGLE_DOWN = 2¶
TRIANGLE_UP = 1¶
shapes._pick_neighbourhood_(shape_type, center_row, center_col)¶

Returns a neighbourhood in absolute coordinates for a shape type

Parameters:

  • shape_type – determines the neighbourhood set used

  • center_row – the row of a central cell

  • center_col – the column of a central cell

Returns:

a list of tuples (row, col) representing a neighbourhood

shapes.init_shape_fill_templates(tile_grid)¶

Grows the shapes on a grid and initializes shape templates :param tile_grid: A tile grid used to extract max tile size
